intro: Zornia oligantha, commonly known as the smallleaf zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and clustered, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and chaparral habitats. Zornia oligantha is an annual or perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid environments.
